alert.note: Alert for Eastern Douglas County Foothills; Klamath Basin; Northern and Eastern Klamath County and Western Lake County; Siskiyou Mountains and Southern Oregon Cascades; South Central Oregon Cascades (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued November 28 at 2:34PM PST until December 02 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON ABOVE 4000 FEET... * WHAT...Potential for heavy snow above 4000 feet. A good chance for total snow accumulations of 1 to 2 feet. Winds could gust as high as 35 mph over exposed terrain. * WHERE...Elevations above 4000 feet in the Oregon Cascades, northern Klamath County and north western Lake County. This includes Crater Lake, Lake of the Woods, Diamond Lake Junction and Highway 97 north of Chiloquin. * WHEN...From Thursday afternoon through Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible over 5500 feet. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow accumulation will primarily fall in two rounds Thursday evening and Friday night. Snow accumulation could continue through Sunday as a warm front approaches the region. Snow levels will likely rise up to 7000 feet by Monday evening. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Stock emergency kit with tire chains, flashlight, batteries, blankets, food, water, and medications. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * Plan now to avoid traveling during the storm. Do not detour during winter storms. * A Winter Storm Watch means there is potential for significant snow accumulations that may create dangerous travel.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Douglas County Foothills; Klamath Basin; Northern and Eastern Klamath County and Western Lake County; Siskiyou Mountains and Southern Oregon Cascades; South Central Oregon Cascades
